meanings.def: a group of twelve of the same thing
examples: half a dozen bottles of wine

meanings.def: a group of approximately twelve people or things
examples: The company employs no more than a couple of dozen people.
Only about half a dozen people turned up.
There was only space for a half-dozen tables.
There were two dozen or so, men mostly, all looking a little bored.

meanings.def: a lot of people or things
examples: dozens of something I've been there dozens of times.
We interviewed dozens and dozens of people.
in dozens They arrived in dozens (= in large numbers).
Babies are turning up in their dozens to be snapped for the paper's Baby of the Year competition.

meanings.def: very common and therefore not valuable
used to say that there is not much real difference between two possible choices

examples: She was chatting away, nineteen to the dozen.

idioms.def: very common and therefore not valuable

idioms.idiom: it’s six of one and half a dozen of the other
idioms.def: used to say that there is not much real difference between two possible choices

idioms.idiom: talk, etc. nineteen to the dozen
examples: She was chatting away, nineteen to the dozen.
